metadata.description: Full IELTS Listening Practice Test with 4 sections covering various topics and question types

sections.title: Bankside Recruitment Agency
sections.description: Information about a recruitment agency and their services
sections.instructions: Complete the notes below. Write ONE WORD AND/OR A NUMBER for each answer.

questions.question: Name of agent: Becky ______

context.fullContext:
Address of agency: 497 Eastside, Docklands
Name of agent: Becky ______
Phone number: 07866 510333

questions.question: Best to call her in the ______

context.fullContext:
Phone number: 07866 510333
Best to call her in the ______

questions.question: Must have good ______ skills

context.fullContext:
Clerical and admin roles, mainly in the finance industry
Must have good ______ skills

questions.question: Jobs are usually for at least one ______

context.fullContext:
Must have good communication skills
Jobs are usually for at least one ______
Pay is usually £10 per hour

questions.question: Pay is usually £ ______ per hour

context.fullContext:
Jobs are usually for at least one week
Pay is usually £ ______ per hour

questions.question: Wear a ______ to the interview

context.fullContext:
Wear a ______ to the interview
Must bring your passport to the interview

questions.question: Must bring your ______ to the interview

context.fullContext:
Wear a suit to the interview
Must bring your ______ to the interview
They will ask questions about each applicant's personality

questions.question: They will ask questions about each applicant's ______

context.fullContext:
Must bring your passport to the interview
They will ask questions about each applicant's ______

questions.question: The ______ you receive at interview will benefit you

context.fullContext:
The ______ you receive at interview will benefit you
Will get access to vacancies which are not advertised

questions.question: Less ______ is involved in applying for jobs

context.fullContext:
Will get access to vacancies which are not advertised
Less ______ is involved in applying for jobs

sections.title: Matthews Island Holidays - Isle of Man
sections.description: Information about holiday packages to the Isle of Man
sections.instructions: Choose the correct letter A, B or C for questions 11-14. Complete the table for questions 15-20.

questions.question: According to the speaker, the company
options: has been in business for longer than most of its competitors
arranges holidays to more destinations than its competitors
has more customers than its competitors

questions.question: Where can customers meet the tour manager before travelling to the Isle of Man?
How many lunches are included in the price of the holiday?
Customers have to pay extra for
Hotel dining room has view of the ______

context.tableTitle: Timetable for Isle of Man holiday
context.fullContext:
Day 1: Arrive - Introduction by manager
Notes: Hotel dining room has view of the ______

questions.question: Tynwald may have been founded in ______ not 979

context.tableTitle: Timetable for Isle of Man holiday
context.fullContext:
Day 2: Tynwald Exhibition and Peel
Notes: Tynwald may have been founded in ______ not 979

questions.question: Travel along promenade in a tram; train to Laxey; train to the ______ of Snaefell

context.tableTitle: Timetable for Isle of Man holiday
context.fullContext:
Day 3: Trip to Snaefell
Notes: Travel along promenade in a tram; train to Laxey; train to the ______ of Snaefell

questions.question: Company provides a ______ for local transport and heritage sites

context.tableTitle: Timetable for Isle of Man holiday
context.fullContext:
Day 4: Free day
Notes: Company provides a ______ for local transport and heritage sites

questions.question: Take the ______ railway train from Douglas to Port Erin

context.tableTitle: Timetable for Isle of Man holiday
context.fullContext:
Day 5: Take the ______ railway train from Douglas to Port Erin
Free time, then coach to Castletown

questions.question: Free time, then coach to Castletown – former ______ has old castle

context.tableTitle: Timetable for Isle of Man holiday
context.fullContext:
Take the steam railway train from Douglas to Port Erin
Free time, then coach to Castletown – former ______ has old castle

sections.title: Birth Order and Personality Research
sections.description: A discussion about research on how birth order affects personality traits
sections.instructions: Match personality traits to birth order positions for questions 21-26. Choose the correct letter for questions 27-28. Choose TWO letters for questions 29-30.

questions.question: the eldest child

context.instructions: What did findings of previous research claim about the personality traits a child is likely to have because of their position in the family? Choose SIX answers from the box and write the correct letter, A-H.
rightColumn: a child with much older siblings

questions.question: a middle child

context.instructions: What did findings of previous research claim about the personality traits a child is likely to have because of their position in the family? Choose SIX answers from the box and write the correct letter, A-H.
rightColumn: a child with much older siblings

questions.question: the youngest child

context.instructions: What did findings of previous research claim about the personality traits a child is likely to have because of their position in the family? Choose SIX answers from the box and write the correct letter, A-H.
rightColumn: a child with much older siblings

questions.question: a twin

context.instructions: What did findings of previous research claim about the personality traits a child is likely to have because of their position in the family? Choose SIX answers from the box and write the correct letter, A-H.
rightColumn: a child with much older siblings

questions.question: an only child

context.instructions: What did findings of previous research claim about the personality traits a child is likely to have because of their position in the family? Choose SIX answers from the box and write the correct letter, A-H.
rightColumn: a child with much older siblings

questions.question: a child with much older siblings

context.instructions: What did findings of previous research claim about the personality traits a child is likely to have because of their position in the family? Choose SIX answers from the box and write the correct letter, A-H.
rightColumn: a child with much older siblings

questions.question: What do the speakers say about the evidence relating to birth order and academic success?
options: There is conflicting evidence about whether oldest children perform best in intelligence tests
There is little doubt that birth order has less influence on academic achievement than socio-economic status
Some studies have neglected to include important factors such as family size

questions.question: What does Ruth think is surprising about the difference in oldest children's academic performance?
options: It is mainly thanks to their roles as teachers for their younger siblings
The advantages they have only lead to a slightly higher level of achievement
The extra parental attention they receive at a young age makes little difference

questions.question: Which TWO experiences of sibling rivalry do the speakers agree has been valuable for them?
options: B learning to stand up for oneself
C learning to be a good loser

sections.title: The Eucalyptus Tree in Australia
sections.description: A lecture about the eucalyptus tree, its importance and reasons for decline
sections.instructions: Complete the notes below. Write ONE WORD ONLY for each answer.

questions.question: it provides ______ and food for a wide range of species

context.fullContext:
it provides ______ and food for a wide range of species
its leaves provide oil which is used to make a disinfectant

questions.question: its leaves provide ______ which is used to make a disinfectant

context.fullContext:
it provides shelter and food for a wide range of species
its leaves provide ______ which is used to make a disinfectant

questions.question: lime used for making ______ was absorbed

context.fullContext:
Cause – lime used for making ______ was absorbed
– trees were unable to take in necessary iron through their roots

questions.question: ______ feed on eucalyptus leaves

context.fullContext:
Cause – ______ feed on eucalyptus leaves
– they secrete a substance containing sugar
– bell-miner birds are attracted by this and keep away other species

questions.question: high-frequency bushfires have impact on vegetation, resulting in the growth of ______

context.fullContext:
high-frequency bushfires have impact on vegetation, resulting in the growth of ______
mid-frequency bushfires result in the growth of eucalyptus forests

questions.question: make more ______ available to the trees

context.fullContext:
mid-frequency bushfires result in the growth of eucalyptus forests, because they:
– make more ______ available to the trees
– maintain the quality of the soil

questions.question: maintain the quality of the ______

context.fullContext:
– make more water available to the trees
– maintain the quality of the ______

questions.question: low-frequency bushfires result in the growth of '______ rainforest'

context.fullContext:
low-frequency bushfires result in the growth of '______ rainforest', which is:
– a simple ecosystem
– an ideal environment for the nest of the bell-miner

questions.question: a ______ ecosystem

context.fullContext:
low-frequency bushfires result in the growth of 'dry rainforest', which is:
– a ______ ecosystem
– an ideal environment for the nest of the bell-miner

questions.question: an ideal environment for the ______ of the bell-miner

context.fullContext:
– a simple ecosystem
– an ideal environment for the ______ of the bell-miner
